title: Ensaculin
text: Ensaculin (KA-672) is a drug from the <a href="coumarin">coumarin</a> family, which has been researched as a potential treatment for <a href="dementia">dementia</a>. It acts on a number of receptor systems, being both a weak <a href="NMDA%20antagonist">NMDA antagonist</a> and a <a href="5HT1A%20receptor">5HT1A</a> agonist. Animal studies have shown promising <a href="nootropic">nootropic</a> effects, although efficacy in humans has yet to be proven. It was well tolerated in human trials, with the main side effect being orthostatic <a href="hypotension">hypotension</a> (low blood pressure).
